critique: The document establishes a commission to study and report on the future revenue needs and resources of the nation's public and non-public elementary and secondary schools. It covers a wide range of topics, including fiscal status, expenditure growth, tax policy, financial structure, and potential cooperation between public and non-public schools. The commission is authorized to appoint personnel, obtain services, and enter into contracts for studies. The Department of Health, Education, and Welfare is tasked with providing administrative and staff support. The commission is required to present interim reports and a final report within two years, after which it will terminate.
